articles.author: Alex Bye
articles.title: Is it still a good idea to take aspirin to prevent heart disease? Here's what the evidence says - The Conversation
articles.description: If you take a daily low-dose aspirin to prevent heart disease and you’ve never had heart problems before, you might want to talk to your doctor.
articles.content: You might have heard that taking a daily low-dose aspirin can reduce your risk of developing heart disease. But, unless you have been told to take aspirin by your doctor, recent news should make you … [+3342 chars]

articles.title: The Guardian is ignoring the risks of testosterone on trans people - UnHerd
articles.description: A new article in the Guardian cautions that testosterone prescriptions for women experiencing the menopause are spiralling “out of control”, with “long-term implications” for female health. Experts even go so far as to warn about the influence of “testosteron…
articles.content:
Imbecile, you have no excuse to claim any risk is ignored. Now if you will claim the NHS, a socialist medical system, is generically incompetent I can take that at face value . . .
. . . But to wail… [+2329 chars]

articles.author: Neuroscience News
articles.title: Pathway for Migraine with Aura Discovered - Neuroscience News
articles.description: Researchers have discovered why migraines are often one-sided, revealing that proteins released during aura are carried to pain-signaling nerves via cerebrospinal fluid.
articles.content: Summary: Researchers have discovered why migraines are often one-sided, revealing that proteins released during aura are carried to pain-signaling nerves via cerebrospinal fluid. This study highlight… [+6924 chars]
